poem:
**Return to Studio 8H**

Under the bright, borrowed lights,  
a ghost from a Western walks in,  
his laughter a tenuous thread—  
a needle skimmed through long shadows,  
sketching the outline of days not forgotten,  
while a cheer erupts from behind curtains,  
the past a costume on a rack,  
tonight's script rolling, rolling on.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Saturday Night Live: Michael Keaton hosts and Alec Baldwin cameos in middling episode The fourth episode of Saturday Night Live season 50 kicks off with the surprise return of Alec Baldwin – only the second time he has appeared on the show since his accidental fatal shooting of a crew member on the set of the movie Rust, and his first since the charges against him were dismissed. Related: Saturday Night Live: Ariana Grande hits". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Saturday Night Live: Michael Keaton hosts and Alec Baldwin cameos in middling episode The fourth episode of Saturday Night Live season 50 kicks off with the surprise return of Alec Baldwin – only the second time he has appeared on the show since his accidental fatal shooting of a crew member on the set of the movie Rust, and his first since the charges against him were dismissed. Related: Saturday Night Live: Ariana Grande hits
